boat.construction_details: grp balsa core  plywood raised floor glassed over (self-draining)

for_sales.sales_text:
Open to offers
Built 1985, re-built 2012 Built: Isle of Man Type: Sloop Home: Port St Mary Rig: Gaff LOA 26’ Designed by: Nick Wyatt and Peter Whipp Built by Freedom Yachts Re-built by Mick Kneale. Abandoned in 1990 in a field, with the lid chopped off, one of three Panda 711s built. Although balsa core sandwich construction, they were built in a female mould. One is in the Clyde and another in N. Wales still with their original rig, a huge Bermudan main with a tiny jib.

Mick Kneale was given the remains of the hull, the top having been chopped off along the sheerline and a big hole where the keel had been removed. He has raised the the freeboard to make it into a dayboat. The watertight raised floor is made of 9mm Robins Elite ply, glassed over. She is a gaff sloop rig with alloy spars and the fixed keel has a 315 kg bulb drawing 2.15m.

Sails: Mainsail, Genoa, jib, staysail, 2 x asymmetric spinnakers plus a superb Parasail. Boat is a fully rigged dayboat with all lines, compass, anchor, fenders, sail covers etc. 6hp Tohatsu outboard (2 tanks), Novasail NS360+ instrument, Banks winter boat cover and cradle.

In local racing, we find it sails on average slightly quicker than a Bolero and slightly slower than a First Class 8. Photo albums of Genesta II and its rebuild on my Facebook page. YTC handicap 907/929

boat.full_description:
Abandoned in 1990 in a field, with the lid chopped off, one of three Panda 711s built. Although balsa core sandwich construction, they were built in a female mould. One is in the Clyde and another in N. Wales still with their original rig, a huge Bermudan main with a tiny jib.

Mick Kneale was given the remains of the hull, the top having been chopped off along the sheerline and a big hole where the keel had been removed. He has raised the the freeboard to make it into a dayboat. The watertight raised floor is made of 9mm Robins Elite ply, glassed over.

She is a gaff sloop rig with alloy spars and the fixed keel has a 315 kg bulb drawing 2.oom.
boat.name: Genesta II
boat.short_description: Genesta II, previously known as Ching Ching, was originally built as a small cruiser/racing yacht.
